page.title: 12Daily Life In Bentley
page.content: Nursery Cottage is the{home}of one of the workers in{employment}at Upper Bentley Farm. It was built in 17th century and stands in 1.3 acres.In 1826 it was used as a barn.The foreman from Bentley Manor lived there and the fir trees for the Bentley plantation were grown there in the garden and transported to the Thrift.The floor in the dining room is part of the remains of the Manor. Most food was grown in the cottage garden or delivered.{Shopping}was done three times a week, usually on foot. Now the car is used once a week. Animals were slaughtered there but no longer. The occupant, his brother and their father worked for a total of 100 years on Upper Bentley Farm. His brother is the earth-stopper for the Worcestershire {Hunt,}as was his father.
